Class Board

  • java.lang.Object
    • Board

  • public class Board
extends java.lang.Object
    The Board class is used for creating the Board that the game will be played on.

    Board

    Date: 2016/05/24

    Version:
    1 2016/05/24
    Author:
    David White and Sepehr Hosseini

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Board(Deck playerDeck, Deck computerDeck)
      This constructer creates a new Board which uses the player's deck.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void clearBoard()
      This method clears the Board by setting the values of the Cards on the Board to null.
      void computerAttack()
      This method assigns the cards that the computer will play on the board from the computer's hand when it's attacking.
      void computerDefend()
      This method assigns the cards that the computer will play on the board from the computer's hand when it's defending.
      void computerTurn()
      This method is used to perform the computer's actions when it is the computer's turn.
      int currentNumber()
      This method is used to return the index of the current number.
      int currentOperator()
      This method is used to return the index of the current operator.
      void dealHand()
      This method deals the hands of the player and computer by dealing operators and numbers from their respective decks.
      Card[] getBoard(int side)
      This method returns the cards on the board for the specified side.

      This method is used to return a Card on a specified location on the specified side's board based on it's index.

      This method returns a Deck class based on the integer parameter passed in.

      This method calculates the value of the player or computer's defend.

      This method is used to return the current number.

      This method is used to return the current operator.
      int getPoints(int side)
      This method returns the points of the specified side.
      boolean isValidMove()
      This method is used to determine whether or not the player has all the essential Cards on the Board before pressing enter.
      void nextNumber()
      This method is used to move through the numbers in the player's hand.
      void nextOperator()
      This method is used to move through the operators in the player's hand.
      void nextTurn()
      This method prepares the Board for the next turn and changes the turn number.
      boolean numbersInHand(int side)
      This method is used to determine whether or not the specified side has any numbers in their hand.
      boolean operatorsInHand(int side)
      This method is used to determine whether or not the specified side has any operators in their hand.
      void pauseTimer()
      This method is used to pause the timer.
      void playNumber(int side, int index, int location)
      This method is used to play a number onto the Board from the current Card in the player's hand depending on whether it is the first number or the second number in the sequence.
      void playOperator(int side, int index)
      This method is used to play an operator onto the Board from the current Card in the player's or computer's hand.

      This method is used to reset the timer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Board

        public Board(Deck playerDeck,
             Deck computerDeck)
        This constructer creates a new Board which uses the player's deck.

        Local variables:

        task Reference to the TimerTask class.

        Parameters:
        playerDeck - the player's deck that will be used for the entire game on the Board.
        computerDeck - the computer's deck that will be used for the entire game on the Board.

      • getDeck

        public Deck getDeck(int side)
        This method returns a Deck class based on the integer parameter passed in.
        Parameters:
        side - this determines if it is the computer's or player's deck.
        Returns:
        Deck the specified deck

        public void dealHand()
        This method deals the hands of the player and computer by dealing operators and numbers from their respective decks.

        This method clears the Board by setting the values of the Cards on the Board to null.

      • getPoints

        public int getPoints(int side)
        This method returns the points of the specified side.
        Parameters:
        side - whether it is the computer or player.
        Returns:
        int the points of the specified side.

      • updateScore

        public void updateScore()
        This method updates the score of the computer and the player when a set of cards are entered.

        Local variables:

        score This variable holds the resulting score change for the round.

      • getDefend

        public int getDefend(Card[] attackBoard,
                     Card[] defendBoard)
        This method calculates the value of the player or computer's defend.
        Parameters:
        attackBoard - this is used to distinguish between the cards of the player or the computer when attacking.
        defendBoard - this is used to distinguish between the cards of the player or the computer when defending.
        Returns:
        int the amount of points that results from the exchange.

      • playOperator

        public void playOperator(int side,
                         int index)
        This method is used to play an operator onto the Board from the current Card in the player's or computer's hand.

        Local variables:

        temp This variable is used to set the index of the current operator in the hand back to the value of the Cards on the board after a new board value has been set.

        Parameters:
        side - whether it is the computer or player.
        index - the index to be played at.

      • playNumber

        public void playNumber(int side,
                       int index,
                       int location)
        This method is used to play a number onto the Board from the current Card in the player's hand depending on whether it is the first number or the second number in the sequence.

        Local variables:

        temp This variable is used to set the index of the current number in the hand back to the value of the Cards on the board after a new board value has been set.

        Parameters:
        location - this determines whether it is the first or second number in the sequence to be placed onto the Board.
        side - whether it is the computer or player.
        index - the index to be played at.

      • getBoard

        public Card[] getBoard(int side)
        This method returns the cards on the board for the specified side.
        Parameters:
        side - the specified side to retrieve the cards from.
        Returns:
        Card[] the cards on the specified side's Board.

      • getBoardCard

        public Card getBoardCard(int side,
                         int location)
        This method is used to return a Card on a specified location on the specified side's board based on it's index.
        Parameters:
        location - the index used to determine the location of the Card on the specified side.
        side - the specified side to retrieve the Card from.
        Returns:
        Card the Card at the specified location.

        public boolean numbersInHand(int side)
        This method is used to determine whether or not the specified side has any numbers in their hand.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        true if the specified side has any number cards in their hand

        public boolean operatorsInHand(int side)
        This method is used to determine whether or not the specified side has any operators in their hand.
        Parameters:

        Returns:
